TITLE: Overwhelmed hospitals. Staffing shortages. Businesses closing. Here's how the Omicron wave is ravaging local communities

SUMMARY: The first snow of the winter season is forecast for some areas across the South and Mid-Atlantic on Sunday and Monday.

TITLE: Investigators are determining if a child under 5 with a lighter may have caused deadly Philadelphia fire
SUMMARY: Investigators are working to determine the cause behind a deadly fire in Philadelphia that took the lives of 12 people on Wednesday.

TITLE: Bidens to tour damage from massive Colorado wildfire
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden are scheduled to travel to Colorado on Friday to meet with families who were affected by a recent massive wildfire that destroyed hundreds of homes and thousands of acres.

TITLE: Sen. Mark Kelly raises nearly $9 million in final three months of 2021
SUMMARY: Sen. Mark Kelly raised nearly $9 million in the final three months of 2021, a figure that surpasses what he raised in the previous three months and positions the Arizona Democrat to be one of the best funded candidates in the 2022 midterms.

TITLE: Big Tech could brush off rate hikes. Startups may struggle
SUMMARY: Apple, Microsoft, SoFi and Coinbase all sold off sharply this week, as investors, anticipating higher interest rates, dumped tech stocks and bought shares of companies they believed were undervalued.

TITLE: Mortgage rates just climbed past 2021 levels
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates started off 2022 with a bang, as the average rate moved higher than at any point last year.

TITLE: 6,000 miles through 7 countries. Why companies are turning to long-haul trains
SUMMARY: When the freight train pulled into view, it looked like many others at this rail hub in suburban Paris. But one thing made the train unusual: its journey started more than 6,000 miles away, in western China.

SUMMARY: A teen accused of killing four fellow students at a Michigan high school in November waived his right to a preliminary examination Friday, nudging the case toward trial without prosecutors needing to first persuade a judge they have probable cause to accuse him.

TITLE: Pelosi invites Biden to give State of the Union speech on March 1
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Friday asked President Joe Biden to deliver the annual State of the Union address to Congress on March 1.

SUMMARY: Republicans are growing bullish that Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson will launch his reelection campaign in 2022, setting the stage for a bruising race that could determine control of the Senate and whether former President Donald Trump will continue to have one of his staunchest allies in the chamber.

TITLE: In a turbulent year for theaters, Disney still won the box office
SUMMARY: In a turbulent year when the pandemic continued to upend the business of movie-going and streaming blockbusters at home became commonplace, one thing returned to normal: Disney topped the box office.

SUMMARY: As school district officials and the teachers union continue to negotiate a return to classrooms, Chicago Public Schools announced Thursday that while most schools will be closed again Friday, a few will have in-person learning and activities.

SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Friday asked President Joe Biden to deliver the annual State of the Union address to Congress on March 1.

TITLE: Analysis: Biden's credibility is now on the line
SUMMARY: In marking the anniversary of the Capitol insurrection, President Joe Biden rediscovered the sense of mission and political clarity that had disappeared when his presidency slumped during a cascade of crises in the second half of 2021.

TITLE: Senate Democrats vow they'll pass voting rights legislation with or without Republicans. Here's what their proposals would do
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer has set the stage for a showdown this month over voting rights -- pledging to muscle through sweeping new federal legislation aimed at counteracting moves by Republicans in state capitols to restrict access to the ballot.

TITLE: Republicans down to 4 finalist cities for convention
SUMMARY: Republicans have selected the four potential host cities for their 2024 convention, according to a spokesperson for the Republican National Committee.

SUMMARY: Kanye West is expanding his sellout Yeezy Gap line by bringing on luxury fashion powerhouse brand Balenciaga.

TITLE: People desperate for Covid tests turn to resellers online
SUMMARY: When Patrick Kennedy, a nightlife performer in New York City, recently tested positive for Covid-19, he was desperate to find more rapid tests to not only monitor his health but track when he'd be able to return to work.

TITLE: Attorneys ask to delay state trial of officers charged in George Floyd's deat
SUMMARY: Prosecutors and defense attorneys representing the three former Minneapolis police officers charged with aiding and abetting in George Floyd's death filed a joint motion on Friday, asking the court to again delay the start of the state trial for the former officers in March due to the upcoming federal civil rights trial for the former officers set to begin later this month.

TITLE: Ransomware attack affects 5,000 school websites
SUMMARY: A ransomware attack on software provider Finalsite has affected the websites of about 5,000 schools, most of them in the US, a Finalsite spokesperson told CNN Friday.

TITLE: Biden administration signs first contract for free rapid Covid-19 test distribution

SUMMARY: Schools are not only wrestling with how to educate children amid the surge in coronavirus cases. They are also contending with feeding kids as inflation and supply chain problems disrupt their ability to serve meals.

TITLE: Judge dismisses sole criminal charge against former Gov. Andrew Cuomo

SUMMARY: On Wednesday, Sen. Ted Cruz told the truth about what happened at the US Capitol on January 6, 2021, calling it "a violent terrorist attack on the Capitol, where we saw the men and women of law enforcement demonstrate incredible courage."

TITLE: Shoplifting is surging across America with dangerous and costly consequences
SUMMARY: Retailers have always been vulnerable to shoplifting. But the emergence of coordinated and organized robberies at high-value stores, even during shopping hours, has the industry on edge.

SUMMARY: The New Orleans City Council voted unanimously Thursday to change the name of Robert E. Lee Boulevard to Allen Toussaint Boulevard, councilmember Jared C. Brossett confirmed to CNN Saturday.

TITLE: The death of a man who caught on fire after being tased by police is under investigation

TITLE: South Dakota places further restrictions on medication abortions

SUMMARY: Former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid was remembered by a host of top Democratic politicians at his memorial service in Las Vegas on Saturday, with former President Barack Obama recalling him as a fighter "who did not give up" and President Joe Biden hailing the Nevada Democrat as someone who "would always have your back."

SUMMARY: South Dakota Sen. John Thune, the No. 2 Republican in the Senate, announced Saturday he is running for re-election in 2022.
